page.title: 04Large Dairy Farm, N. Lopham
page.content:
There are many large farms in our area, such as the locally famous dairy farm belonging to the Alston family, about two miles outside North Lopham. At present James Alston runs the farm, but it was started by his grandfather in 1912. The family own 1,130 acres in North Lopham and use 210 of these acres for grass for the herd. They have built up the herd for 25 years.
The cows are Holstein Friesians, which give a high milk yield. At the moment, they have 174 cows. The herd has got 10% smaller recently and is unlikely to grow in the near future, because of the quotas the Common Market has put on milk production. Mr. Alston thinks the dairy side of farming helps balance the cereal side. He finds it a demanding, but satisfying job.
